title: Which typeface is the Omron logo based on?
content:
Many logotypes seem to use characters derived from Handel Gothic. But, Hadel Gothic would be much better if it had a complete set of uppercase characters at the lowercase size and a complete set of lowercase characters at the uppercase size, I think.

This Omron logo seems to use the lowercase "m"s and the uppercase "R" (modified a bit); but, whenever I reduce an uppercase character to a lowercase size, the weight is too thin.

Do you think the designers of this logo used a combination of a regular weighht and a bold weight of Handel (with slight modifications); or, is there a font that more closely resembles these letters?

Thank you...

comments.content: No closer font. It's built of Handel, plus extra parts and curves. [The 'R' is very Eras](http://web.archive.org/web/20140708015638/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.38.0.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=R&sampleSize=96).
If you need to rebuild it, it would be quicker to trace in Illustrator than start with a font.
